KPK Identifikasi Poin Krusial pada Putusan Bebas Sofyan Basir
06 Nov 2019, 00:20 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Mantan Dirut PLN Sofyan Basir menjalani sidang lanjutan kasus dugaan suap terkait proyek PLTU Riau-1 dengan agenda pembacaan tuntutan di Pengadillan Negeri Tipikor, Jakarta, Senin, 7 Oktober 2019. (CNN Indonesia/Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) mulai melakukan penyisiran terhadap sejumlah poin krusial dalam putusan bebas Sofyan Basir di tingkat pertama Pengadilan Tipikor Jakarta. Juru Bicara KPK Febri Diansyah mengatakan poin-poin tersebut meliputi pengetahuan Sofyan terkait penerimaan uang dari Eni Maulani Saragih hingga perbuatan mantan Dirut PLN tersebut yang dinilai membantu percepatan penandatanganan proyek PLTU Riau-I.Hal itu dilakukan KPK guna menentukan langkah selanjutnya dalam menindaklanjuti putusan bebas ini."Kami, KPK, juga sudah mulai mengidentifikasi ada beberapa poin yang cukup krusial yang belum dipertimbangkan oleh majelis hakim di tingkat pertama ini," kata Febri kepada wartawan di Kantornya, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11) malam."Misalnya yang cukup krusial adalah terkait dengan pertanyaan apakah terdakwa Sofyan Basir mengetahui atau tidak adanya peran suap yang diterima oleh Eni Maulani Saragih sejumlah sekitar Rp4,75 miliar bersama dengan pihak lain dari Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo," ucap Febri lagi.Febri memandang bukti tersebut luput dari pertimbangan majelis hakim dalam menjatuhkan vonis. Sofyan dalam persidangan, kata Febri, menyampaikan bahwa dirinya pernah menerima informasi terkait dengan kepentingan Eni yang diutus Partai Golkar untuk mencari pendanaan kegiatan partai. Hal itu juga dikuatkan oleh kesaksian Eni di dalam persidangan."Nah, ini belum dipertimbangkan sehingga nanti ini akan kami uraikan lebih lanjut," tandasnya."Jadi kami akan uraikan lebih lanjut termasuk keterangan yang pernah disampaikan oleh Sofyan Basir dalam kasus sebelumnya, meskipun itu dicabut di persidangan tetapi JPU juga sudah bertanya pada saat itu apakah misalnya ada tekanan dari penyelidik atau penyidik dalam melakukan pemeriksaan, dan tidak ada tekanan dalam proses pemeriksaan tersebut sehingga mestinya tidak logis dan tidak relevan alasan mencabut BAP tersebut," terang Febri.Teruntuk poin BAP ini, Febri mengatakan pihaknya bakal menjelaskan lebih lanjut dalam kasasi di Mahkamah Agung. Dia berharap majelis hakim kasasi dapat memberikan pertimbangan yang komprehensif dan substansial. Kendati begitu, ia tidak bisa memastikan kapan kasasi diajukan lantaran pihaknya masih menunggu salinan lengkap putusan Sofyan Basir."Tapi poin ini akan kami jelaskan lebih lanjut pada rumusan memberi kasasi ke MA. Kami harap nanti di MA akan ada pertimbangan yang jauh lebih komprehensif dan substansial agar kita benar-benar bisa menemukan kebenaran materiil dalam perkara ini," pungkasnya.Selain itu, KPK juga menyoroti soal perbuatan perbantuan Sofyan dalam mempercepat penandatanganan kontrak PLTU Riau-I. "Karena kalau kita lihat ke belakang dari OTT Juli 2018, sebenarnya yang diinginkan oleh suap dari Kotjo pada Eni adalah agar untuk mengurus percepatan penandatanganan proyek PLTU Riau-I itu. Dan peran terdakwa Sofyan Basir adalah kami duga membantu," ujarnya lagi.Majelis hakim Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi Jakarta memvonis bebas Sofyan dalam kasus dugaan korupsi proyek PLTU Riau-I. Sofyan dinilai tak terbukti dalam kasus yang juga menjerat mantan Sekretaris Jenderal Partai Golkar Idrus Marham dan mantan Wakil Ketua Komisi VII DPR RI Eni Maulani Saragih."Menyatakan Sofyan Basir tidak terbukti secara sah dan meyakinkan bersalah sebagaimana dakwaan pertama dan kedua," ujar Ketua Majelis Hakim Pengadilan Tipikor Jakarta Hariono saat membacakan amar putusan, Jakarta, pada Senin (4/11). (ryn/fea)

KPK Identifies Crucial Points in Sofyan Basir's Free Verdict
Nov 6 2019, 00:20 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Former Managing Director of PLN Sofyan Basir underwent a follow-up case of alleged bribery related to the Riau-1 PLTU project with the agenda of reading demands in the Tipikor District Court, Jakarta, Monday, October 7, 2019. (CNN Indonesia / Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) began sweeping a number of crucial points in Sofyan Basir's acquittal at the first level of the Jakarta Corruption Court. KPK Spokesman Febri Diansyah said the points included Sofyan's knowledge related to receiving money from Eni Maulani Saragih until the former PLN Managing Director's actions were considered to help accelerate the signing of the Riau-I. PLTU project. This was done by the KPK to determine the next steps in following up this free decision "We, the KPK, have also begun to identify there are quite crucial points that have not been considered by the judges at the first level," Febri told reporters at his office, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5) night. "For example, quite crucial "This is related to the question whether the defendant Sofyan Basir knows or does not have the role of bribery received by Eni Maulani Saragih in the amount of around Rp. 4.75 billion along with other parties from Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo," said Febri again. sentence. Sofyan in the trial, said Febri, said that he had received information related to the interests of Eni sent by the Golkar Party to seek funding for party activities. This was also corroborated by Eni's testimony during the trial. "Well, this has not been taken into consideration so we will explain further later," he said. "So we will elaborate further including information that was given by Sofyan Basir in the previous case, even though it was revoked at trial but the prosecutor had also asked at that time whether for example there was pressure from the investigator or investigator in conducting the examination, and there was no pressure in the examination process so it should not be logical and irrelevant the reason for revoking the BAP, "explained Febri. For BAP points this, Febri said it would explain further in an appeal in the Supreme Court. He hoped the panel of judges could give a comprehensive and substantial consideration. Even so, he could not be sure when the appeal was filed because it was still waiting for a complete copy of Sofyan Basir's decision. "But we will explain this point further in the formulation of giving an appeal to the Supreme Court. We hope that later in the Supreme Court there will be far more comprehensive and substantial considerations. so that we can truly find the material truth in this case, "he concluded. In addition, the KPK also highlighted the matter of Sofyan's assistance in accelerating the signing of the Riau-I PLTU contract. "Because if we look back from the OTT in July 2018, what is really desired by the bribery of Kotjo in Eni is to take care of the acceleration of the signing of the Riau-I PLTU project. And the role of the defendant Sofyan Basir is that we are suspected of helping," he said. The Jakarta Corruption Court sentenced Sofyan to be acquitted in the alleged corruption case of the Riau-I PLTU project. Sofyan was deemed unproven in the case which also ensnared former Golkar Party Secretary General Idrus Marham and former Deputy Chair of the House of Representatives Commission VII Eni Maulani Saragih. "Stating Sofyan Basir was not legally proven and convincingly guilty as the first and second indictments," said Chief Justice Jakarta Corruption Court Hariono when reading the verdict, Jakarta, on Monday (4/11).
